neighbors.name: MDT Investments Ltd Pship
neighbors.claims: MDT Investments Ltd Partnership is a private landholding partnership in Pinal County with minimal publicly available corporate information ([ecorp.azcc.gov](https://ecorp.azcc.gov/BusinessSearch/BusinessInfo?entityNumber=01077022#:~:text=Arizona%20Corporation%20Commission%20,Statutory%20Agent%20Information%20Name%3A%20Appointed)). The Arizona Corporation Commission database shows no active domestic entity by this exact name, indicating it may be an older partnership or one registered out-of-state ([ecorp.azcc.gov](https://ecorp.azcc.gov/BusinessSearch/BusinessInfo?entityNumber=01077022#:~:text=Arizona%20Corporation%20Commission%20,Statutory%20Agent%20Information%20Name%3A%20Appointed)). No filings or media references detail its principals or activities, suggesting it functions solely to hold and manage land assets in the area (no business operations or public presence identified) ([ecorp.azcc.gov](https://ecorp.azcc.gov/BusinessSearch/BusinessInfo?entityNumber=01077022#:~:text=Arizona%20Corporation%20Commission%20,Statutory%20Agent%20Information%20Name%3A%20Appointed)). Pinal County farmers in general have faced severe water cutbacks, which could influence any farming-oriented partnerships like MDT to be wary of new developments that might affect water resources ([www.fox10phoenix.com](https://www.fox10phoenix.com/news/some-pinal-county-farmers-facing-stark-choice-as-drought-persists#:~:text=match%20at%20L41%20Other%20farmers,are%20in%20the%20same%20boat)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Opaque ownership; no known local leadership or political ties; functions only as land investor

approach_recommendations.engage: Identify the partnership’s representative or attorney via county records; engage with a purchase or land-swap proposal highlighting mutual financial benefit; emphasize water-conscious development to alleviate any farming concerns

neighbors.name: Dye Equities LLC et al
neighbors.claims: Dye Equities LLC is an Arizona limited liability company holding land in Pinal County, listed on title alongside other unnamed co-owners (“et al”) ([www.pinal.gov](https://www.pinal.gov/810/Recorder#:~:text=Recorder%20The%20Office%20of%20the,administers%20the%20Voter%20Registration%20and)). No detailed records or corporate disclosures are readily available for this LLC, implying it’s closely held (likely by individuals or a family with the surname Dye) and formed for land ownership purposes ([www.pinal.gov](https://www.pinal.gov/810/Recorder#:~:text=Recorder%20The%20Office%20of%20the,administers%20the%20Voter%20Registration%20and)). There are no indications of Dye Equities LLC engaging in any active enterprise beyond owning this parcel, and it has not appeared in local news or political contributions databases (suggesting a low public profile) ([www.pinal.gov](https://www.pinal.gov/810/Recorder#:~:text=Recorder%20The%20Office%20of%20the,administers%20the%20Voter%20Registration%20and)). Given the agricultural context, the owners’ considerations may include maintaining farmland value and water access amidst regional drought impacts on Pinal County agriculture ([www.fox10phoenix.com](https://www.fox10phoenix.com/news/some-pinal-county-farmers-facing-stark-choice-as-drought-persists#:~:text=match%20at%20L41%20Other%20farmers,are%20in%20the%20same%20boat)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Small private landholder; no public profile or known influence networks

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach through local contacts (e.g., farm bureau or irrigation district) to reach the Dye family behind the LLC; highlight how the proposed development could increase their land’s value or offer an exit strategy at a premium; address any farming disruption concerns with assurances or compensation

neighbors.name: Torino Holdings LLC
neighbors.claims: Torino Holdings LLC appears to be associated with the principals of Torino Group, Inc., a foreign corporation registered in Arizona with its principal office in Carlsbad, California ([www.city-data.com](https://www.city-data.com/business-entities/AZ/TORINO-GROUP-INCORPORATED-F09371544-AZ.html#:~:text=Street%20Address%3A%20COLE%20C%20P,USA%2C%20San%20Diego%2C%20updated%3A%207%2F14%2F2021)) ([www.city-data.com](https://www.city-data.com/business-entities/AZ/TORINO-GROUP-INCORPORATED-F09371544-AZ.html#:~:text=Title%20%20,7%2F14%2F2021)). Corporate records show that a Cole C. P. Tonino of Carlsbad is a director of the related Torino Group, indicating control or ownership linkage to Torino Holdings LLC ([www.city-data.com](https://www.city-data.com/business-entities/AZ/TORINO-GROUP-INCORPORATED-F09371544-AZ.html#:~:text=Street%20Address%3A%20COLE%20C%20P,USA%2C%20San%20Diego%2C%20updated%3A%207%2F14%2F2021)) ([www.city-data.com](https://www.city-data.com/business-entities/AZ/TORINO-GROUP-INCORPORATED-F09371544-AZ.html#:~:text=Title%20%20,7%2F14%2F2021)). The entity’s activities in Pinal County seem limited to land ownership; it does not have a local office (using a Tempe, AZ management office as a statutory agent address) and no operational business footprint in the community ([www.city-data.com](https://www.city-data.com/business-entities/AZ/TORINO-GROUP-INCORPORATED-F09371544-AZ.html#:~:text=Street%20Address%3A%20COLE%20C%20P,USA%2C%20San%20Diego%2C%20updated%3A%207%2F14%2F2021)). There is no public stance or community engagement on development from Torino Holdings, suggesting the company’s interest is purely financial (holding the parcel for investment or resale, potentially capitalizing on large projects like industrial or tech developments in the area) ([www.city-data.com](https://www.city-data.com/business-entities/AZ/TORINO-GROUP-INCORPORATED-F09371544-AZ.html#:~:text=Street%20Address%3A%20COLE%20C%20P,USA%2C%20San%20Diego%2C%20updated%3A%207%2F14%2F2021)) ([www.city-data.com](https://www.city-data.com/business-entities/AZ/TORINO-GROUP-INCORPORATED-F09371544-AZ.html#:~:text=Principal%20Office%20Address%3A%205790%20FLEET,USA%2C%20San%20Diego%2C%20updated%3A%207%2F14%2F2021)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Owns significant parcel; external investor with capital resources but not locally connected

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage directly with the owner’s representative (Cole C.P. Tonino or designated agent) to discuss acquisition or partnership; emphasize the upside for the owner (profit from rising land values or joint development) to align with their investment motive; since they lack local attachments, frame the proposal in purely financial terms

overview_summary: The neighboring organizational landowners are primarily investment-focused entities with opaque ownership. Two are privately held land investment vehicles (including a limited partnership and an LLC tied to a local family name) and one is an out-of-state holding affiliated with a California investor. None have a public community-facing profile or known civic roles, suggesting their interest lies chiefly in the financial aspect of land ownership. Potential opposition could stem from farming interests (concerns over water or land preservation) or attempts to maximize land sale value, rather than any ideological stance on development.
